portal.email_subtitle: Access all member benefits and resources

overview.benefits_intro: Your benefits as a FASE founder member include:

community.title: Unique access to a pan-European MGA community
community.description_1: For capacity and service providers, FASE membership offers unique access to the European MGA market. For MGAs, FASE offers access to capacity and service providers from around the world that can help them grow their business.
community.description_2: Our membership directory is now available and we expect it to grow substantially in the coming months.

brand.title: Brand endorsement
brand.description_1: FASE members are entitled to display the FASE logo on their websites and marketing materials, reflecting your commitment to the highest professional standards as reflected in the FASE Code of Conduct.
brand.description_2: You can upload your company logo, bio, and website URL via the Manage Profile tab to be featured in our member directory.

matching.title: Capacity and distribution matching
matching.description_1: In Q1 2026, we will be launching a tool in the portal to show the distribution of business lines across our MGA population.  A carrier or broker member wishing to see which European MGAs are writing warranty & indemnity insurance or pet insurance will be able to do so instantly.
matching.description_2: Ahead of the 2026 MGA Rendezvous in May, we will also be inviting participating FASE member MGAs and carriers to describe, respectively, their risk focus and risk appetite in detail so that they can hold productive and efficient meetings at the Rendezvous.  The information obtained from this exercise will be held - subject to members' permission - on the members' portal to support capacity and distribution matching during and after the Rendezvous.

data.title: Data and insights
data.description: You have received three member logins to obtain access to a range of resources to support the growth of their businesses in Europe, including:

regulatory.title: Regulatory analysis
regulatory.description_1: Regulations affecting MGAs in Europe are often poorly matched to the MGA business model and vary widely across European jurisdictions. Through a panel of expert legal advisors, FASE is coordinating the provision of high-quality regulatory guidance for members across different markets.
regulatory.description_2: Starting in Q1 2026, this portal will house an interactive map of European states, reflecting the principal regulations impacting MGAs in those countries. More detailed analysis of regulatory issues will also be provided in The Entrepreneurial Underwriter, the federation's monthly online publication.

report.title: Annual market report
report.description: FASE's annual market report will provide a clear picture of the size, growth rate, and composition of the European MGA market, while enabling members to benchmark their performance against the broader market. The first FASE annual report will be published in January 2027.

webinars.title: Webinar archive
webinars.description: All of FASE's educational webinars, focusing on issues of concern to MGAs, will be archived within this portal. We will be sending you invitations to our webinar series.

relationships.title: Relationship building (The 2026 MGA Rendezvous and other events)
relationships.description_1: The MGA Rendezvous, our annual conference, will unite the European MGA community for a day and a half of relationship-building and networking, accompanied by presentations from leading lights in the market.
relationships.description_2: The 2026 MGA Rendezvous will take place on May 11 and 12 this coming year at the Hotel Arts in Barcelona.
relationships.description_3: We're designing the format of the Rendezvous to connect, in the most efficient way possible, European underwriting talent and local market expertise with insurers and reinsurers from around the world.
relationships.description_4: Over one and a half days, the Rendezvous will bring MGAs and capacity providers together in a structured format to build relationships and pursue profitable growth opportunities. Prior to the event, we'll be inviting insurers and reinsurers to share information on their risk appetite and MGAs to share information on their risk focus.
relationships.description_5: The result, we hope, will be efficient and productive meetings with not a minute wasted.
relationships.description_6: The Rendezvous will also include a world-class program of presentations and panel discussions by leading lights within the European MGA market.

member_discounts.title: Member discounts
member_discounts.description_1: Registration for the 2026 MGA Rendezvous will open on January 12. Passes to the event are deeply discounted (by 50%) for FASE members.
member_discounts.description_2: A pass for an MGA member of FASE will be €400, versus the non-member MGA rate of €800. For a carrier the discounted rate will be €550, versus the non-member carrier rate of €1,100.
member_discounts.description_3: For service providers, the member rate is €700, versus €1,400.

logo_access.description: As a FASE member, you are entitled to display the FASE logo on your website and marketing materials, reflecting your commitment to the highest professional standards.

usage.instructions: Click on colored countries to see MGAs operating there. Use the filter to view headquarters locations or market territories. Search for specific companies using the search box above.

february_2026.welcome_intro: Welcome to the February edition of The Entrepreneurial Underwriter, FASE's bulletin for the European delegated underwriting community.
february_2026.welcome_summary: In this issue: a closer look at delegated authority at Lloyd's Europe, captive strategies for MGAs, and a snapshot of how FASE's community is growing.
february_2026.lloyds_title: Lloyd's in Europe: Coverholder Business Growing Fast After 123 Years
february_2026.lloyds_summary: Lloyd's EEA and Swiss coverholder business now accounts for 28% of Lloyd's total premium from the region. We separate myth from reality with Lloyd's own data.
february_2026.captives_title: Seven Reasons to Consider a Captive
february_2026.captives_author: By Mark Elliott, Polo Insurance Managers
february_2026.captives_summary: The role of reinsurance captives has been growing in the capacity stack of MGAs. Mark Elliott highlights why profitable MGAs should consider establishing a captive.
february_2026.top_lines_of_business: Top Lines of Business (by % of MGA members)
february_2026.lloyds_resources_intro: Lloyd's has provided the following slide decks for FASE members considering a coverholder relationship with the market.
february_2026.lloyds_datapoints_desc: Country-by-country breakdown of coverholder counts and GWP across the EEA and Switzerland
february_2026.lloyds_da_desc: Introduction to the Lloyd's coverholder model, including approval criteria, key contacts and next steps
february_2026.rendezvous_summary: More than 170 delegates have registered, representing 35 MGAs, 20 carriers and seven service providers. Total attendance is expected to exceed 500.
february_2026.rendezvous_discount: FASE members benefit from a 50% discount on passes.
